issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
While trying to recreate the imaging service worker, I had already enabled an keyname:

[root@g-15-08 ~]# euca-describe-properties services.imaging | grep keyname
PROPERTY	services.imaging.worker.keyname	imaging

This caused the following stacktrace with a failure condition:


{code:java}

{code}

If the cloud administrator created a keypair that was to be used for the imaging worker (or any service worker) it should ignore that setting when creating a new worker, but should allow it to be used later after the worker is running.  Failing to create the worker if keyname is enabled should not happen.
fields.summary: 'esi-manage-stack -a create imaging' fails if ssh keyname property set to true

comments.body: [~mbacchi], I think you hit EUCA-10893. Have you created imaging keypair in eucalyptus account?
This does appear to be a dup of EUCA-10893 so closing.

worklogs.comment: This does appear to be a dup of EUCA-10893 so closing.
